MLB.schemaNote: Modeled after your NBA template (fields adapted to baseball). Entries reflect 2025 regular-season context as of Oct 4, 2025. League/division and core identity are stable; some clubs have in-flux manager/FO notes due to active offseason changes.

Arizona Diamondbacks.status: Pitching-forward club with athletic defense; Wild Card range
Arizona Diamondbacks.market: Phoenix metro; surging post-2023 title run halo
Arizona Diamondbacks.style: Contact + speed, run prevention, modern bullpen usage
Arizona Diamondbacks.narrative: Post-’23 pennant, Arizona leaned into run prevention and athleticism while cycling young arms.
Arizona Diamondbacks.headline: Desert run prevention — athletic D-backs try to out-execute the West
Arizona Diamondbacks.stars: Corbin Carroll, Zac Gallen, Gabriel Moreno

Atlanta Braves.status: Perennial contender retooling staff; still elite offense core
Atlanta Braves.style: Power + patience, deep lineup, efficient run prevention
Atlanta Braves.narrative: Postseason letdowns haven’t dimmed a top-5 offense; staff tweaks and health headline 2025.
Atlanta Braves.headline: Reloading on the fly — bats still thunderous in ATL
Atlanta Braves.stars: Ronald Acuña Jr., Matt Olson, Austin Riley

contractDynamics.extensions: Multiple core hitters locked long term

Baltimore Orioles.style: Athletic defense, contact quality, deep pen
Baltimore Orioles.narrative: Homegrown wave keeps surging; window firmly open.
Baltimore Orioles.headline: Birdland boom — sustainable winner built from within
Baltimore Orioles.stars: Adley Rutschman, Gunnar Henderson, Corbin Burnes

recentPerformance.trend: Top of AL East mix per official standings.

Boston Red Sox.status: On the rise; revamped player dev bearing fruit
Boston Red Sox.style: Contact quality, Green Monster exploitation, improving pen
Boston Red Sox.narrative: Turned a corner with youth + value adds; East dogfight factor again.
Boston Red Sox.headline: From reset to relevance — Fenway’s youth movement sticks
Boston Red Sox.stars: Rafael Devers, Triston Casas, Brayan Bello

Chicago Cubs.status: Balanced club pushing to top of Central
Chicago Cubs.narrative: Core consolidation + targeted adds keep them in October mix.
Chicago Cubs.headline: North Side sustainability — pitching/defense sets floor
Chicago Cubs.stars: Cody Bellinger, Seiya Suzuki, Justin Steele

Chicago White Sox.narrative: Organizational reset with youth and asset accumulation.
Chicago White Sox.headline: South Side reset — prospects drive the plan
Chicago White Sox.stars: Colson Montgomery, Luis Robert Jr. (health watch)

Cincinnati Reds.status: Explosive, volatile youth core; playoff chase
Cincinnati Reds.narrative: Electric athletic group maturing; bullpen leverage key.
Cincinnati Reds.headline: Cincy’s fun chaos — talent surge aims for October
Cincinnati Reds.stars: Elly De La Cruz, Hunter Greene, Matt McLain

recentPerformance.trend: Bubble to WC contender per standings.

Cleveland Guardians.status: Pitching factory + elite defense; division staple
Cleveland Guardians.narrative: System keeps churning arms; offense adds just enough punch.
Cleveland Guardians.headline: Contact & gloves — Guardians keep the AL Central honest
Cleveland Guardians.stars: José Ramírez, Emmanuel Clase, Shane Bieber (FA/health watch)

Colorado Rockies.style: Contact at Coors; pitching development hurdles
Colorado Rockies.narrative: Longer runway with amateur pipeline; aim to stabilize run prevention.
Colorado Rockies.headline: Climbing slowly — Rockies rebuild around hit/field foundation
Colorado Rockies.stars: Kris Bryant (health), Ezequiel Tovar, Nolan Jones

Detroit Tigers.narrative: Pitching depth keeps door open; run scoring uptick decides ceiling.
Detroit Tigers.headline: Motor City mound surge — bats seek league-average
Detroit Tigers.stars: Tarik Skubal, Riley Greene, Kerry Carpenter

Houston Astros.status: Aging core still dangerous; arms health monitored
Houston Astros.narrative: Window still cracked open with Bregman/Altuve/Yordan; rotation churn a focus.
Houston Astros.headline: Still October-savvy — core vets try to extend run
Houston Astros.stars: Yordan Alvarez, Jose Altuve, Alex Bregman

Kansas City Royals.narrative: Witt Jr. ascended; Royals’ next step hinges on rotation depth.
Kansas City Royals.headline: Witt-powered rise — K.C. back in the mix
Kansas City Royals.stars: Bobby Witt Jr., Cole Ragans, Vinnie Pasquantino

Los Angeles Angels.narrative: Post-Ohtani identity still forming; manager opening among offseason storylines.
Los Angeles Angels.headline: OC reset — stabilizing the staff is job one
Los Angeles Angels.stars: Mike Trout (availability managed), Logan O’Hoppe, Zach Neto
Los Angeles Angels.culture: In search of sustainable pitching dev

Los Angeles Dodgers.style: Power + plate discipline + waves of pitching
Los Angeles Dodgers.narrative: Title-or-bust expectation with star nucleus and unmatched depth.
Los Angeles Dodgers.headline: Machine keeps humming — title standard in L.A.
Los Angeles Dodgers.stars: Mookie Betts, Freddie Freeman, (plus star SP adds)

Miami Marlins.narrative: Post-2023 WC, Miami retools around young pitching.
Miami Marlins.headline: Arms again — can offense keep up?
Miami Marlins.stars: Jazz Chisholm Jr., Jesús Luzardo (health), Eury Pérez (rehab/innings)

recentPerformance.trend: NL East lower tier; arms health decisive.

Milwaukee Brewers.status: Model franchise for pitching/defense; repeated contenders
Milwaukee Brewers.narrative: Front office keeps turning over staff and competing; 2025 top MLB record tier.
Milwaukee Brewers.headline: Perpetual contenders — pitching factory keeps humming
Milwaukee Brewers.stars: William Contreras, Christian Yelich, Freddy Peralta

recentPerformance.trend: Top MLB record range per official tables.

risksAndChallenges.floor: Early exit if bats go cold

Minnesota Twins.status: Division favorite profile; October breakthrough target
Minnesota Twins.narrative: Sustained depth has stabilized the AL Central outlook.
Minnesota Twins.headline: North Star power — Twins aim to lock Central
Minnesota Twins.stars: Royce Lewis, Carlos Correa, Pablo López

New York Mets.status: High-spend retool; rotation identity in progress
New York Mets.style: OBP + star sluggers; arms TBD year to year
New York Mets.narrative: Aggressive FO keeps toggling between buy/hold; aim to stabilize pitching pyramid.
New York Mets.headline: Big-market recalibration — Queens eyeing steadier staff
New York Mets.stars: Francisco Lindor, Pete Alonso, Kodai Senga

New York Yankees.style: Power, patience, premium defense up the middle
New York Yankees.narrative: Top-2 AL record tier; Bronx expectations reset to rings-or-bust.
New York Yankees.headline: Bronx power — title standard renewed
New York Yankees.stars: Aaron Judge, Juan Soto, Gerrit Cole

recentPerformance.trend: AL East co-lead tier per official tables.

Oakland Athletics.narrative: Young roster cycles with relocation context; long-runway plan.
Oakland Athletics.headline: In flux — development under relocation cloud

Philadelphia Phillies.narrative: Deep playoff résumé; 2025 top MLB record tier.
Philadelphia Phillies.headline: Red October perennial — power + aces
Philadelphia Phillies.stars: Bryce Harper, Trea Turner, Zack Wheeler

Pittsburgh Pirates.status: Promising core; aiming to exit rebuild for good
Pittsburgh Pirates.narrative: Sustainable climb with Reynolds/Cruz cornerstone and young arms.
Pittsburgh Pirates.headline: Bridge to contention — kids and Reynolds lead
Pittsburgh Pirates.stars: Bryan Reynolds, Oneil Cruz, Paul Skenes

San Diego Padres.status: Star power still present; resourceful retool
San Diego Padres.narrative: Post big-payroll swings, SD remains dangerous with star bats.
San Diego Padres.headline: Petco punch — Padres still swing big
San Diego Padres.stars: Fernando Tatis Jr., Manny Machado, Xander Bogaerts

San Francisco Giants.narrative: Post-Kapler/Melvin churn, SF seeks a steady skipper and clearer lineup identity.
San Francisco Giants.headline: By the Bay, a reset — Giants hunt for cohesion

Seattle Mariners.narrative: Arms keep floor high; offense consistency decides top end.
Seattle Mariners.headline: Sea of arms — M’s chase sustained October
Seattle Mariners.stars: Julio Rodríguez, George Kirby, Luis Castillo

St. Louis Cardinals.narrative: Reset underway with modernized mound approach.
St. Louis Cardinals.headline: The Cardinal Way 2.0 — modern mound focus
St. Louis Cardinals.stars: Nolan Arenado, Paul Goldschmidt (role), Sonny Gray

Tampa Bay Rays.narrative: Churn and injuries never fully derail; Rays keep finding edges.
Tampa Bay Rays.headline: Forever optimized — Rays Math keeps them in it
Tampa Bay Rays.stars: Yandy Díaz, Randy Arozarena, Zach Eflin

Texas Rangers.style: Star bats + power arms; injuries dictated 2025
Texas Rangers.narrative: Post-’23 title, Texas battled 2025 inconsistency; new manager hired Oct 2025.
Texas Rangers.headline: Back to boots-on-ground — Rangers aim for healthy reset
Texas Rangers.stars: Corey Seager, Adolis García, Nathan Eovaldi

Toronto Blue Jays.status: AL East champs with frontline rotation and star bats
Toronto Blue Jays.market: National — all of Canada’s team; massive media footprint
Toronto Blue Jays.style: Power + patience lineups, Gausman-fronted rotation, creative pen usage
Toronto Blue Jays.narrative: Toronto broke through in 2025, winning the AL East under John Schneider and returning to October with a deep staff and middle-of-the-order thunder. Health for Bo Bichette is the key subplot entering the postseason.
Toronto Blue Jays.headline: North rises — Jays reclaim the East and a first-round bye
Toronto Blue Jays.stars: Vladimir Guerrero Jr., Bo Bichette, Kevin Gausman
Toronto Blue Jays.watchability: High — packed Rogers Centre, star power, big-game feel
Toronto Blue Jays.culture: Process-driven and data-forward with clubhouse continuity

recentPerformance.trend: Won AL East at 94–68; clinched postseason and first-round bye

contractDynamics.extensions: Long-term paths for core bats monitored
contractDynamics.tradeWatch: Bench RH bat and leverage reliever depth

narrativeAnglesToWatch: Schneider’s bullpen leverage map in October
Guerrero Jr. HR/BB surge in playoff environment

Washington Nationals.status: Organizational reset — new PBO in, youth wave leading
Washington Nationals.market: Capital region; engagement building with prospects
Washington Nationals.style: Speed/athleticism with improving contact skills; young arms headline
Washington Nationals.narrative: After dismissing Dave Martinez and Mike Rizzo in July 2025, Washington elevated Miguel Cairo to interim manager and Mike DeBartolo to interim GM, then hired 35-year-old Paul Toboni as President of Baseball Operations on Oct. 1. The on-field results lagged, but a clear scout-and-dev mandate is set for 2026 and beyond around Abrams, Wood, Crews and Gore.
Washington Nationals.headline: Fresh blueprint on South Capitol — Toboni era begins
Washington Nationals.stars: CJ Abrams, MacKenzie Gore, James Wood
Washington Nationals.watchability: Medium — prospect flashes and elite tools
Washington Nationals.dysfunction: Medium — midseason upheaval stabilizing under new leadership
Washington Nationals.culture: Reoriented toward scouting + player development, accountability, and modern processes

frontOffice.president: Paul Toboni (President of Baseball Operations, hired Oct 1, 2025)

recentPerformance.trend: Finished 30 games under .500; worst run prevention in club era outside Expos-2000; reset underway

contractDynamics.capShape: Clean — space to buy prospects via salary intake
contractDynamics.tradeWatch: Veteran rentals for relief/bench; claim-and-fix arms

risksAndChallenges.ceiling: Meaningful step toward .500 if kids pop
risksAndChallenges.floor: NL bottom tier if arms regress

narrativeAnglesToWatch: Toboni’s hires (manager/GM structure) and player-dev revamp
